20230316_1409452592×4608 2.08 MB

20230316_1409342592×4608 2.01 MB

We are using a thrifty style elevator and we have this issue where the elevator carriage rope loses tension when we go up, is this intended or can we just cut it at the clamp plates?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T21:13:21.544Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":204,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":1077.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"Ibrahim","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/9/89e2518ca5d9535410b94560e3576eb2490ae15d.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/e/a/eacd23a33bb276d16c47cf983cc68a491f9e72aa.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51059,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3166397,"name":"Max Mayer","username":"mjmayer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjmayer/{size}/174629_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T21:16:28.762Z","cooked":"

The bottom cable tensioner is in the wrong location, it’s supposed to be on the same carriage as the top tensioner.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T21:16:28.762Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":73.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"Max Mayer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2667 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/2","custom_user_title":"2667 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166486,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-17T00:39:37.024Z","cooked":"

To clarify @mjmayer’s comment, the lower tensioning pulley and cam should be installed in the two holes on the lower carriage rail indicated by the red arrow:

That will give you proper tension and pull-down on the return. You might even have enough rope there that you won’t need to restring the elevator (if you’re lucky, anyway.)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-17T00:39:37.024Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/4","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166488,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-17T00:44:52.969Z","cooked":"

Actually, you’re looking at the wrong stage. The one on the middle stage should be moved down to the bottom of the robot so it doesn’t move when the elevator goes up. That middle stage then pushes up on the string, pulling the inner stage up relative to the middle stage. Where you mount it on the inner stage doesn’t matter.

Edit to add: what is this plate doing?

I suspect that is what provides the tension to raise the inner stage as it is, otherwise the inner stage wouldn’t move. If so, that slack would almost be unneeded cable that could be removed, with the plate at the top holding that end of the cable.

20230316_1838432592×4608 1.82 MB

We ended up doing what was suggested and it works fairly well now, but it does lose tension as it goes up, although not as much.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-17T01:39:30.036Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"Ibrahim","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/f/8/f86e46efc87257686a453e2f765a8a325572ac63.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51059,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166584,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-17T03:32:17.366Z","cooked":"

That plate is where the string is clamped off at the bottom stage and is what does the cascade motion.

SheptheSheep:

We ended up doing what was suggested and it works fairly well now, but it does lose tension as it goes up, although not as much.

Check for any rope runs that are not running perfectly straight. The block on the top of the first stage looks like it is mounted on the wrong side of the boxtube and should be mounted to the other side. Any amount of misalignment can cause the string to change effective length due to the string acting as a triangle with changing side lengths instead of a straight line. Exaggerated MS paint drawing for reference.

image927×697 7.35 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-17T03:32:17.366Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/1/1/117f805c1d7ece02600b3b12726e017cd0e55ac2.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166792,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-17T14:40:06.357Z","cooked":"

Jon…

That’s not a correct pulley placement for the Thrifty Elevator. The stage to carriage line is a loop and that upper plate pins one part of the loop in place. The end of the line needs to go where I indicated. If they did what you suggest, the thing wouldn’t move unless you pulled the plate.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-03-17T14:42:20.238Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":44.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":430556,"topic_slug":"thrifty-elevator-problems","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/thrifty-elevator-problems/430556/8","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3166833,"name":"Ryan Dognaux","username":"Ryan_Dognaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_dognaux/{size}/129138_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-17T16:03:35.475Z","cooked":"

Hey folks, appreciate you seeing this and trying to help. OP if you have additional questions you can always just PM me or send an e-mail at contact@thethriftybot.com and I’d be happy to help more there as well.

Some of the posts here are correct, the bottom rope tensioning CAM parts needs to move UP onto the bottom of your carriage stage. Your rope pulley should stay where it is on the sliding 2nd stage and the rope should feed thru that pulley as well like it does on the top of your setup.

There are 2 tensioning CAM parts so that you’re able to dial in the tension of the rope from either side after you’ve clamped the rope down using the clamping plate at the top of your cross bar.

image1885×2019 297 KB

The clamping plate at the top essentially creates 2 fixed lengths of rope using 1 single rope.

image511×1082 92.7 KB

image812×871 154 KB

Let me know if you have any additional questions.

Thanks,

Ryan
